noun.description: The action or skill of reading written or printed matter silently or aloud.
examples: a cursory reading of the minutes

noun.description: An occasion at which poetry or other pieces of literature are read aloud to an audience.

examples: his reading of the situation was justified

noun.description: A figure or amount shown by a meter or other measuring instrument.
examples: radiation readings were taken every hour

noun.description: A stage of debate in parliament through which a Bill must pass before it can become law.
examples: the Bill returns to the House for its final reading next week

proper noun.description: A town in southern England, on the Kennet River near its junction with the River Thames; population 142,300 (est. 2009).
An industrial and commercial city in southeastern Pennsylvania, on the Schuylkill River; population 80,506 (est. 2008).
